Posts.Content: Nioz24 wrote: Hi, I am a concern 39 yr oldwith a huge hard mass (almost my whole left breast) that started with an acute pain less than two months ago. I had done a Mammogram and Ultrasound. The Needle biopsy says it is not cancer just inflammatory cells. The doctor put me on antibiotics but didn't work out. Yesterday I had a small surgery to drain any infection, there was no infection found, just scar tissue. I haven't had any trauma or surgery before so the scar tissue is unexplainable. I am puzzled the doctor told me. A sample of tissue was sent to the lab for a second biopsy and for bacteria detection. Any comments about what might be happening will be greatly appreciated. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Inflammation, mass, scar tissue. Nioz24 Nioz24

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2018 07:54AM Nioz24 wrote: I know anxiety is normal. The surgeon most likely will discuss your exams with you and tell you about the procedure he recommends based on your exams. You don’t have to bring anything except yourself. Your surgeon should have all mammogram, ultrasound, biopsy, and other papers need it. Common questions might be ask by his staff like history of cancer, other diseases you have or have had but don’t overwhelm. Those are routine questions, nothing deep. I would try to make the best out of it. Enjoy every moment for what you have and what you can do. “All things serve for good to those that love The Lord”
Posts.Title: What happens at first consult with breast surgeon? CPB1167 myusername

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2018 08:12AM Nioz24 wrote: I try to enjoy the most, every moment is precious! Your husband loves you and is right there with you when it counts.When I think of my future the thought that comes the quickest is the one of my children (12, 7, 5, and 4 yr old) suffering, been alone or with a stepmom, but I push those thoughts away because they are no positive. Eat healthy, try to sleep enough, exercise regularly, drink abundant water, inhale deep air, get sunshine and have faith in something bigger than yourself.
Posts.Title: My Husband, My Life, My Love, My Family, My Cancer Micmel runor
